channel.title: oracle on The Security Dōjō
channel.description: Recent content in oracle on The Security Dōjō

item.title: AES Padding Oracle I
item.description: When using AES in CBC mode without any integrity checks such as a MAC, it can be possible to leak information about a ciphertext which can lead to full plaintext recovery. Under such circumstances the attacker is able to send arbitrary ciphertexts to be decrypted to an oracle (e.g. application service) and obtain the result of the decryption. If the result indicates that a padding error has occurred, the attacker can use the information to recover the plaintext without knowing the secret key.
